stadium.name: The South Pole Palisade
stadium.description: A crude, fortified playing field built from rough-hewn logs. It's less a stadium and more a stockade against the wilderness. The 'grass' is mostly frozen mud and straw.

stats.pregame_ritual: Smelling their own game-worn socks from the previous match.
Braiding their hair into tight, battle-ready rows.
Listening to the wind for a sign of which way the game will turn.
Getting a teammate to punch them in the shoulder, hard.
Wearing a specific, garishly colored pair of undergarments.
Clapping their hands a prime number of times.
Polishing their boots with bacon grease.
Clapping their hands a prime number of times.
Reciting a short, epic poem about a past victory.
Turning their helmet around three times before putting it on.
Licking a whetstone.

Getting a teammate to punch them in the shoulder, hard.

stadium.name: The Su'akour Bowl
stadium.description: A crude, rowdy stadium built within the half-finished, black-stone walls of the warlord Su'akour's abandoned fortress. The stands are crumbling ruins, and the entire arena perpetually stinks of the nearby sulfur marshes.

stats.pregame_ritual: Kissing their biceps and whispering words of encouragement to them.
Getting a teammate to punch them in the shoulder, hard.
Wearing their boots on the wrong feet during the warm-up.
Washing their hands with dirt.
Asking a teammate to tell them a story, but only the beginning.
Asking the referee to bless their weapon.
Finding the muddiest puddle and stomping in it with bare feet.
Staring at a single blade of grass until their eyes water.
Wiping a teammate's sweat onto their own forehead.
Attempting to communicate with birds.
Consulting a folk rhyme about the weather to predict the game's outcome.
Getting a teammate to punch them in the shoulder, hard.
Wearing their boots on the wrong feet during the warm-up.
Washing their hands with dirt.
Asking the referee to bless their weapon.
Finding the muddiest puddle and stomping in it with bare feet.

Staring at a single blade of grass until their eyes water.

preGame:
Hul-lo Osterra! This is Nok the Corrupter, the voice of Tuesday Night Trollball, coming to you live from the soot-stained ruins of the Su'akour Bowl! üéôÔ∏è We are at a fever pitch tonight, folks, because this is Game 3 of the Losers Bracket Playoffs! It‚Äôs all or nothing, win or go home to a cold meal and a lecture from a 'hero'! The Brimstone Fire Eaters and the South Pole Yetis have split the first two games, and tonight we decide who stays in the dance and who gets tossed out like yesterday‚Äôs garbage! 

The atmosphere here is thick enough to choke a dragon, thanks to the Su'akour sulfur marshes wafting those lovely noxious fumes right over the pitch! üí® I see Nigel Rothmuller over there muttering folk rhymes to the smog‚Äîlet's hope the clouds have good tactical advice! Meanwhile, the Yetis are looking a bit out of their element in the heat. Ajit Serge is standing perfectly still, listening to the wind for a sign. Personally, I think the only sign he'll get is a spiked gauntlet to the jaw, but that‚Äôs why we love the game! 

The popularity for these two might be lower than Sir Tanos' respect for the written word, especially compared to those Zmeigorod darlings, but the intensity is unmatched! The open bar is already flowing, and the fans‚Äîthe few who can stand the smell‚Äîare getting rowdy! We‚Äôve got players wiping sweat on each other, licking whetstones, and getting punched by teammates just to wake up! This is real sport, not like those pampered Haven Lights playing tag in their shiny meadows! Let‚Äôs get ready for some carnage! üí•
postGame:
Jumpin' Jehosaphat, what a way to close out a series! The Brimstone Fire Eaters have defended their crumbling fortress with a 3-0 victory, clinching the series 2-1 and moving on in the playoffs! üèÜ The South Pole Yetis put up a fight, but they‚Äôre heading back to the icebox tonight with nothing but bruises and the smell of sulfur to remember us by! 

The action was hotter than a demon‚Äôs furnace right out of the gate! Nigel Rothmuller, the master of folk rhymes, proved that poetry and violence go hand-in-hand! They charged through the center field, dodged the freezing breath of the defense, and slammed that troll head right into the End Zone for a spectacular dunk! üèÄ The Fire Eaters took a 1-0 lead, and the crumbling walls of the Bowl nearly gave way from the roar of the drunken crowd! 

But you can't have a Trollball match without some medical emergencies, can you? Hilaire Guevara absolutely flattened Wylde Jutta early on, sending them straight to the healer‚Äôs tent! It was a hit so hard I‚Äôm surprised Sir Artorias didn't feel it in his fancy palace! But the Fire Eaters gave it right back. Oona Jane and Nachison Icken turned into a two-person wrecking crew, laying out Ajit Serge and Coussoule Bidle in rapid succession! Talk about surgical violence! ‚öîÔ∏è

By the time we reached halftime, the pitch looked more like a battlefield from the Everwar than a ball field! With the open bar in full swing, I‚Äôm fairly certain the players were seeing three troll heads instead of one! Bollinger Susette was swinging his hatchet at shadows, and I saw Isborne Krause try to tackle a crumbling wall! The fumes and the booze are a dangerous mix, folks, but it makes for one heck of a show! 

In the second half, the Yetis tried to mount a comeback, but the Fire Eater defense was as solid as the black stone of Su'akour! Duky Orelee did his best to turn the tide, sending Nigel Rothmuller to the dirt with a tackle that sounded like a falling glacier. But the Fire Eaters have grit! Even when the legendary Lowson Hersh was taken out by Sayers Erdda, the Brimstone squad didn't blink an eye! 

The nail in the coffin came from the veteran Selimah Tully! After asking the ref to bless his dagger‚Äîwhich I'm sure was a total violation of several rules I don't care about‚Äîhe found himself in the Home 2-Point zone. He let that troll head fly, and it sailed through the sulfur-thick air like a guided missile, right through the hoop! üéØ Two points on the board and the series was practically over! 

The Yetis started fumbling like a bunch of 'heroes' trying to work a real job. Jessy Debbie tried to pass the ball, but I think the bacon grease from their boot-polishing ritual finally caught up to them because that ball slipped away like a greased pig! Possession swapped back to Nigel Rothmuller, and the Yetis could only watch as the clock ticked down on their playoff dreams. 

Final score: Brimstone Fire Eaters 3, South Pole Yetis 0! The Fire Eaters take the series 2-1! It was a masterclass in using the environment; those noxious fumes and uneven ground really played havoc with the southern visitors. Raphael Miyasawa certainly earned her keep today, patching up more holes than a poor man's trousers! 

I‚Äôve got to give a shout-out to my favorites, the Ebon Gate Corruptors‚Äîthey‚Äôd have loved the smell of this place! As for the South Pole Yetis, they fought hard, but maybe next time they should spend less time smelling their own socks and more time practicing their aim! They‚Äôre headed to the lower bracket, and I hope they brought some warm blankets for the trip! 

What a night, Osterra! We saw dunks, we saw shots, and we saw enough blood to satisfy a vampire‚Äôs weekend plans! If you‚Äôre looking for the 'heroes' of the realm, check the local tea house, because the real warriors were right here in the mud! This is Nok the Corrupter, signing off from the Su'akour Bowl! Keep your weapons sharp and your drinks stiff! See you at the next one! üçªüî•
